info.title: Rest Doc_en
info.description:
This web service and its architecture allows any application to connect with PlacetoPay to process cards in Ecuador, regardless of language development.

To use the Web service, you must have a programming language that can communicate with a SOAP or REST service.

The integration method provides basic operations for processing noncards, this is types of credit, interest, OTP generation, authorization, reverse.

Below will be described each of the applications and data required in the frame for each of the cases. The response to each operation is unified in a single resulting frame rate.


**How does it work?**

This is a process for the transaction involving the consumption of the services described herein


1. 1.	Once you capture the card number user consumption information service  is madei`nformationRequest`sending in the request
2. service response is analyzed to have the options that follow
* If the answer brings types of credit "credits" should be shown allow the user to select whichto use.
*  If the answer is the "displayInterest" in true, you must, once a type of credit card selected, you must consume the service interest calculation parameter`interestCalculation`and show the user the response and each time the user switches type credit.
* If the answer is the "requireOtp" in true, you must make the consuming to OTP generation service`otpGeneration` and get the user's code is 6 digits to submit later in the processing service.

3. Once you obtained the type of credit card (if it exists), the OTP (if it is required) service transaction processing  is consumed(processTransaction)and the response may be end (approved, declined or failed) is analyzed or that may be pending. In both cases a value for internalReference store which is very important because it will allow make further query with the service  will be(queryTransaction)returned.
* If the transaction is approved is important also store the authorization number, will allow you to make reverse later if necessary.
*Integration is recommended only where it is not practicable that the user perform the transaction entering sensitive data in PlacetoPay or where a particular control operation is required.

**When is it best used?** 

This mechanism should only be used by those customers that require the platform capture information including sensitive cardholder data. 

Integration is recommended only where it is not practicable that the user perform the transaction entering sensitive data in PlacetoPay or where a particular control operation is required.

 Examples include:

* Recurring Charges from a proprietary database.
* Integration with an audio response system.
* Multiple transactions at different collectors with the same cardholder information.
* Mobile Interface owner, not based on HTML..
* Integration with systems whose sensitive data entry does need to be completed by the cardholder

** What obligations I have when use this integration?**

Note that when using this type of integration, you are providing all data of the buyer including sensitive card data, this fact requires capturing the information in a safe mechanism that does not endanger data cardmember. If the information capture a Web site, the point where these data are captured must be over secure HTTPS protocol using security certificates issued by an accredited certifying agent.

If the capture is performed by a Call Center, who gets sensitive data must be a mechanism IVR (Interactive Voice Response) or audio response; This imply a break in the process from the process performed the operator with your CRM and IVR who capture sensitive data. Finally the CRM consolidates the two sets of data and refers to PlacetoPay.

If the catch comes from a database of previously registered cards, make sure this information is encrypted by a secure encryption mechanism such as AES or 3DES, decrypted only at the time that builds the frame to be sent to PlacetoPay. PlacetoPay has tokenization services that can be used.

Note that as general rule you should not store the card number, expiration date and CVV2. These can only be persistent during the application of the authorization, after processing should not be stored.

Like any integration process, this certification require support staff PlacetoPay to review operational issues, best practices and usability.

**Services**

All consumptions are made to the base URL that will be provided by the area of operations and is added to that URL endpoint of the service to consume.

For example if the base URL was https://placetopay.com to consume the service is a POST request for information is made with the example data to the URL 


** Data Structures**

**Status**

structure containing information about a request or payment, It informs the current state of it.

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| status | string | State provided, could be one of these: [OK, FAILED, APPROVED, REJECTED, PENDING, MANUAL, REFUNDED] |
| reason | string | Reason Code provided. |
| message | string | Description reason code. |
| date | string | Date and time of this state. |

**Payment**

structure containing information about the payment of the required web service transaction

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| reference | string(32) | Reference to the request for payment to link trade. |
| description | string | description of the account. |
| amount | Amount | detail amount receivable in the transaction. |


**Amount**

structure containing information about the payment of the required Web service transaction

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| currency | string | Currency according to **ISO 4217** (alphabetic code) |
| total | decimal | total value. |
| taxes | TaxDetail[] | Description taxes. |
| details | AmountDetail[] | Description total. |

**TaxDetail**

structure to store information about a tax.

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| kind | string | value classification can be [value Added Tax, excise Duty, ice]. |
| amount | double | Discriminated value. |
| base | double | basevalue. |


**AmountDetail**

structure to store information about additional value..

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| kind | string | value classification can be [discount, additional, Devolution Base, shipping, handling, insurance, giftwrap, subtotal, fee, tip] |
| amount | double | discrimination value. |

**Instrument**

structure containing information about the payment method to use in a transaction, this structure is variable according to the request is generated, each service requires that some other data are used..

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| card | Card | card information using. |
| token | Token | token information to use. |
| credit | Credit | Data type of credit to use. |
| otp | string | code information of a generated using |

**Card**

structure containing the information card

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| number | string | complete number card. |
| expirationMonth | string(2) | Month expiration card format MM. |
| expirationYear | string(2) | Year of expiry of the card format YY. |
| cvv | string | Digits verification card. |

**Token**

Structure containing information token associated with the card

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| token | string(64) | alphanumeric token associated with registered card. |
| subtoken | string(16) | numeric token associated with the card. |
| franchise | string(10) | Name code franchise card (diners, visa, visa_electron  amex, master, discover) |
| franchiseName | string(30) | franchise name to show customer. |
| issuerName | string(60) | Name of issuer card can be null if an unknown bin. |
| lastDigits | string(4) | last 4 digits of card. |
| validUntil | string(5) | Expiration Date token, in MM / YY format. |

**Credit**

Structure containing information of the type of credit

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| code | string | type code credit. |
| type | string | type associated the credit. |
| groupCode | string | group code type of loan. |
| installment | int | number of months associated the type of credit. |
| installments | int[] | arrangement with the possible values of number of months allowed the type of credit. |

**InterestValues**

structure containing information calculating interest for credit type and amount

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| original | double | original value of the transaction. |
| installment | double | share value associated the type of credit. |
| interest | double | value of the interest of the transaction. |
| total | double | total value to be paid by the user. |

**AmountConversion**

to define the structure factor conversion and values.

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| from | AmountBase | Amount requested |
| to | AmountBase | Amount processed by the entity. |
| factor | double | conversion factor. |

**AmountBase**

structure representing an amount which defines the coin and the total.

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| currency | string | Coin according to **ISO 4217** (alphabetic code) |
| total | decimal | total value. |

**Person**

structure that reflects the information from a person involved in a transaction.

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| documentType | string | type identification [CI, RUC, PPN, CC, CE, IT, SSN, NIT]|
| document | string | ID. |
| name | string | Name of person |
| surname | string | Surname of the person |
| company | string | name of the company where he works or represents. |
| email | string | Email of the person. |
| address | Address | Complete information address |
| mobile | string | phone number. |

**Address**

structure containing information about a physical address

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| street | string | full physical address. |
| city | string | City name. |
| state | string | name matching state with the address |
| postalCode | string | ZIP or equivalent is usually required for countries that have. |
| country | string | International Country code that applies to the physical address accordance ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 |
| phone | string | Phone Number . |


**Additional data**

Credits cards for tests

Is important to know that this cards has only this behavior under a test enviromen 


| Franquicia | Número | Comportamiento |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| VISA | 4007000000027 | Authorizes |
| VISA | 41111111111111111 | Authorizes |
| VISA | 4212121212121214  | pending |
| VISA | 4005580000000040  | Rejects |
| MASTERCARD | 5424000000000015 | Authorizes |
| AMERICAN EXPRESS | 370000000000002 | Authorizes |
| DINERS  | 36018623456787 | Authorizes |
| CREDENCIAL | 5406251000000008 | Authorizes |

200.description:
**Parámetros**

| Nombre | Tipo | Descripción |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| status | Status | information request status. |
| provider | string | determines the provider that processes the transaction (INTERDIN, Datafast, BANRED) |
| internalReference | bigint | unique code that identifies the transaction systems PlacetoPay. |
| reference | string | reference provided by the trade. |
| paymentMethod | string(5) | code identifying the means of payment used |
| franchise | string | Franchise code used in the transaction (Diners, visa, MasterCard, Discover , Amex) |
| franchiseName | string | franchise name used. |
| issuerName | string | name bank issuing the card used according to our list of bines. |
| amount | Amount | values associated with the transaction. |
| conversion | AmountConversion | Conversion values used for the transaction, always present but not perform exchange. |
| authorization | string | authorization code generated by the provider. |
| receipt | string | code received from the transaction request. |
| type | string | Identifies the operation of the transaction
AUTH_ONLY = Capture Normal CAPTURE_ONLY = the transaction must be approved from the console |
| refunded | bool | Determines if you have performed a reverse this transaction. |
| lastDigits | string | last 4 digits of the card used. |
| additional | array | additional data used intransaction. |

requestBody.description:
Check transaction  (queryTransaction)
POST /gateway/query

**Parámetros**

| name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| auth | Authentication | authentication Information site. |
| internalReference | bigint | unique code represents the transaction PlacetoPay. |

post.description: It allows to consult a transaction.

200.description:
**Parameters**

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| status | Status | Status Information the request. |
| provider | string |Determines the provider processes the transaction (INTERDIN, Datafast, BANRED) |
| cardTypes | string[] | card types supported |
| requireOtp | bool | Determines whether an OTP is needed to process. |
| requireCvv2 | bool | Determines if required obtain the CVV2 user. |
| three DS3DSecure | string | Determines If the card requires prior authentication service 3DSecure (unsupported, required, optional) |
| credits | arrangement types of credit available, empty array if it is not supported by the provider. |


In the example of the response there is a type of credit "DIF PLUS PAYMENT TOTAL" and this has 3, 6, 9, 12 in the arrangement installments, you should be given the option to user to select

DIF PLUS PAYMENT TOTAL (3) months
DIF PLUS PAYMENT TOTAL (6) months
DIF PLUS PAYMENT TOTAL (9) months
DIF PLUS PAYMENT TOTAL (12) months

and so on, this is an example as shown in the redirection service in a select

status.message: La petición se ha procesado correctamente

requestBody.description:
Request for Information  (informationRequest)
POST /gateway/information

**Parameters**

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| auth | Authentication | Authentication Information Site. |
| instrument | Instrument | intake structure for card or token. | 
| payment | Payment | Simple information collection to perform. |

post.description: This service provides information about the card of the user to be processed, as well as the services used for the types of credit, if applicable, each type of credit must be shown with the quotas that are in the arrangement.

payment.description: Ipsam quia sunt dolore minus atque blanditiis corrupti.

requestBody.description:
**parameters**

| Name| Type | Description|
|-----------|------|-------------|
| auth | Authentication | Information site authentication. |
| locale | string | Defined with ISO 639 (language) and ISO 3166-1 codes letters 2-alpha-2 ( from the country).
eg. en_US, es_CO, es_EC |
| payment | Payment | Full information collection to perform. |
| instrument | Instrument | structure input for card or token. |
| payer | Person | Information paying. |
| buyer | Person | Buyer Information. |
| ipAddress | string | IP of the user making the transaction. |
| userAgent | string | UserAgent the user performing the transaction. |
| additional | string[] | key arrangement data value that you wish add and that will be stored. |

post.description:
This service allows charging to the card user, the parameters of the instrument are variable, if such credit or OTP is not asked is not necessary send these variables, Payer is always required, buyer is optional but recommended.

Certification questions, especially with Interdin is necessary once the process is completed the response to the user, this is an example in redirection, all data must be present.

200.description:
**Parámetros**

| Nombre | Tipo | Descripción |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| status | Status | information request status. |
| provider | string | determines the provider that processes the transaction (INTERDIN, Datafast, BANRED) |
| instrument | Instrument | output Structure for token. |

post.description:
This service allows store credit cards safely through a request containing the information of the same of the credit card, a token that can be used when processing is generated and for all purposes, in PlacetoPay equivalent it equals to a credit card, the difference is that the token structure is sent instead of card.

Prior touse of this service should be consulted for information about whether or not is necessary generate an OTP customer and if necessary, request the token and send to the person on consumption.

post.description: This service allows the search of transactions by reference and amount, it is usually used in case of loss of communication when creating a transaction to obtain the internal reference again.

| status | Status | information request status. |
| provider | string | determines the provider that processes the transaction (INTERDIN, Datafast, BANRED) |

security, empty in case the correct OTP is not provided. |
| validated | bool  | Determina si el OTP ha sido verificado. |

post.description:
It allows to validate that the OTP provided agrees with the one sent by the provider, if so,
it will return a “signature” value that must be sent in the processing request as “otp”
this in order to be taken into account when analyzing the transaction by the filters of
security

requestBody.description:
**Parameter**

| Name | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| auth | Authentication | authentication Information site. |
| instrument | Instrument | Structure input for card or token. |
| payment | Payment | Simple information collection to perform. |

Authentication.description:
Structure containing the authentication information generated according to site WSSE UsernameToken Profile 1.1

All requests to the web must be authenticated with Web Services Security UsernameToken Profile 1.1.
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/download.php/13392/wss-v1.1-spec-pr-UsernameTokenProfile-01.htm

Using PasswordDigest

**PasswordDigest = Base64 ( SHA-256 ( nonce + seed + tranKey ) )**

`The login and secretKey are supplied by PlacetoPay`

`This structure must be sent in each request made to the service`

 `The seed cannot have a difference of more than 5 minutes.`
 

**Troubleshooting**

Authentication failure response codes.

| Codigo | Significado |
|-----------|-------------|
| 100 | No UsernameToken provided (Authorization Header Malformed) |
| 101  | Login does not exists (Wrong login, or not the correct environment) |
| 102  | TranKey hash does not match (Malformed or incorrect tranKey) |
| 103  | Seed date older than 5 minutes |
| 104  | Inactive site |
| 105  | Expired site |
| 106  | Expired credentials |
| 107  | Bad UsernameToken definition (Not compliant WSSE header) |
| 200  | Skipping SOAP authentication Header |
| 10001  | Contact Support |


On the right side you can simulate the generation of the authentication required for each of the requests made to the payment gateway (webcheckout), this method receives a login and a trankey through a POST request, internally the processing is performed of the information to return a JSON structure that can be copied and pasted in the other requests within the auth object.

It should be clarified that this method is provided as an aid to generate the authentication structure of the requests and is not part of the webcheckout integration method

url reference authentication: https://placetopay.github.io/web-checkout-api-docs/?shell#authentication-ecuador
